001package io.cyborgcode.roa.api.service;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.authentication.AuthenticationKey;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.authentication.BaseAuthenticationClient;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.client.RestClient;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.core.Endpoint;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.exceptions.RestServiceException;
008import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.validator.RestResponseValidator;
009import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.Assertion;
010import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionResult;
011import io.restassured.http.Header;
012import io.restassured.response.Response;
013import io.restassured.specification.RequestSpecification;
014import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.Objects;
017import lombok.Setter;
018import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
019import org.springframework.context.annotation.Scope;
020import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;
021
022/**
023 * Handles API request execution and response validation.
024 *
025 * <p>This service provides methods to execute API requests, validate responses, and manage authentication.
026 * It integrates with {@link RestClient} for request execution and {@link RestResponseValidator} for validation.
027 *
028 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
029 */
030@Service
031@Scope("prototype")
032public class RestService {
033
034   private final RestClient restClient;
035   private final RestResponseValidator restResponseValidator;
036   private BaseAuthenticationClient baseAuthenticationClient;
037
038   private AuthenticationKey authenticationKey;
039   @Setter
040   private boolean cacheAuthentication;
041
042   /**
043    * Constructs a new {@code RestService} instance.
044    *
045    * @param restClient            The client responsible for executing API requests.
046    * @param restResponseValidator The validator for API responses.
047    */
048   @Autowired
049   public RestService(RestClient restClient, final RestResponseValidator restResponseValidator) {
050      this.restClient = restClient;
051      this.restResponseValidator = restResponseValidator;
052   }
053
054   /**
055    * Constructs a new {@code RestService} instance with caching configuration.
056    *
057    * @param restClient            The client responsible for executing API requests.
058    * @param restResponseValidator The validator for API responses.
059    * @param cacheAuthentication   Whether authentication should be cached.
060    */
061   public RestService(RestClient restClient, final RestResponseValidator restResponseValidator,
062                      boolean cacheAuthentication) {
063      this.restClient = restClient;
064      this.restResponseValidator = restResponseValidator;
065      this.cacheAuthentication = cacheAuthentication;
066   }
067
068   /**
069    * Executes a request without a body.
070    *
071    * @param endpoint The API endpoint to call.
072    * @return The response from the API.
073    */
074   public Response request(Endpoint<?> endpoint) {
075      return executeRequest(endpoint, null);
076   }
077
078   /**
079    * Executes a request with a specified body.
080    *
081    * @param endpoint The API endpoint to call.
082    * @param body     The request body.
083    * @return The response from the API.
084    */
085   public Response request(Endpoint<?> endpoint, Object body) {
086      return executeRequest(endpoint, body);
087   }
088
089   /**
090    * Validates a response against the provided assertions.
091    *
092    * @param response   The response to validate.
093    * @param assertions The assertions to apply.
094    * @param <T>        The type of the assertion results.
095    * @return A list of assertion results.
096    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the response or assertions are null.
097    */
098   public <T> List<AssertionResult<T>> validate(Response response, Assertion... assertions) {
099      if (response == null) {
100         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Response cannot be null for validation.");
101      }
102      if (assertions == null || assertions.length == 0) {
103         throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least one assertion must be provided.");
104      }
105      return restResponseValidator.validateResponse(response, assertions);
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Executes a request and validates the response.
110    *
111    * @param endpoint   The API endpoint to call.
112    * @param assertions The assertions to apply.
113    * @param <T>        The type of the assertion results.
114    * @return A list of assertion results.
115    */
116   public <T> List<AssertionResult<T>> requestAndValidate(Endpoint<?> endpoint, Assertion... assertions) {
117      return requestAndValidate(endpoint, null, assertions);
118   }
119
120   /**
121    * Executes a request with a body and validates the response.
122    *
123    * @param endpoint   The API endpoint to call.
124    * @param body       The request body.
125    * @param assertions The assertions to apply.
126    * @param <T>        The type of the assertion results.
127    * @return A list of assertion results.
128    */
129   public <T> List<AssertionResult<T>> requestAndValidate(Endpoint<?> endpoint, Object body, Assertion... assertions) {
130      return validate(request(endpoint, body), assertions);
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Authenticates a user using a specified authentication client.
135    *
136    * @param username                  The username for authentication.
137    * @param password                  The password for authentication.
138    * @param authenticationClientClass The authentication client class to use.
139    * @throws RestServiceException if authentication fails.
140    */
141   public void authenticate(String username, String password,
142                            Class<? extends BaseAuthenticationClient> authenticationClientClass) {
143      Objects.requireNonNull(username, "Username must not be null");
144      Objects.requireNonNull(password, "Password must not be null");
145      Objects.requireNonNull(authenticationClientClass, "Authentication client class must not be null");
146      try {
147         baseAuthenticationClient = authenticationClientClass.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
148         authenticationKey = baseAuthenticationClient.authenticate(this, username, password, cacheAuthentication);
149
150      } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException
151               | NoSuchMethodException e) {
152         throw new RestServiceException("Error instantiating or authenticating with BaseAuthenticationClient.", e);
153      }
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Executes a request to the specified endpoint.
158    *
159    * @param endpoint The API endpoint.
160    * @param body     The request body (optional).
161    * @return The API response.
162    * @throws RestServiceException if an error occurs during request execution.
163    */
164   private Response executeRequest(Endpoint<?> endpoint, Object body) {
165      if (endpoint == null) {
166         throw new RestServiceException("Endpoint cannot be null.");
167      }
168      try {
169         RequestSpecification spec = endpoint.prepareRequestSpec(body);
170
171         if (baseAuthenticationClient != null && authenticationKey != null) {
172            Header header = baseAuthenticationClient.getAuthentication(authenticationKey);
173            if (header != null) {
174               spec.header(header);
175            }
176         }
177
178         return restClient.execute(spec, endpoint.method());
179      } catch (Exception e) {
180         throw new RestServiceException("Error executing request for endpoint: " + endpoint.url(), e);
181      }
182   }
183}
